channel.title: Death respawn Point
channel.description:
I've asked this here and there, but never got a clear response:
How do I change my death respawn point!? Like, what folder & what do I search. I searched "death" in client.java and all player files, but got nothing relating to coords. So..... Any help?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 20, 2009, 05:49:01 pm[/size][hr]Also, how can I create monster drops? I know it's in drops.cfg, but I don't understand the coding. Any help there?

item.title: Death respawn Point
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

maxmurks:

Just try searching for the coords that it takes you to now. 2899, 3557 I think you said. You may have to change it multiple places. :eek:

Would I search for

teleportToX = 2899; teleportToY = 3557;

or what?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 21, 2009, 07:36:01 am[/size][hr]FIXED. ^^" Thx dude

Read full topic

item.title: Death respawn Point
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Being all honest, that didn’t work. :s

But I figured it out by going on a new acc and getting myself killed, searching the death message and the coords happened to be right above it. ^^’’

Thanks for the help, though.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 20, 2009, 06:46:03 pm[/size][hr]Nevermind, about me fixing it. Idk wtf I’m doing wrong, but it always brings me back to the same place!!!

Here’s my death coding…

[code]public void youdied()
{
for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) {
try {
int item = playerEquipment[r];
if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
remove(item, r);
}
} catch(Exception e) { sendMessage(“ERROR: Removing Equipment”); }
}
for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) {
try {
if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {
//createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
//createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]);
deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]);
}
} catch(Exception e) { }
}
removeAllItems();
for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) {
try {
int item = playerEquipment[r];
if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
remove(item, r);
}
} catch(Exception e) { sendMessage(“ERROR: Removing Equipment”); }
}
for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) {
try {
if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {
//createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
//createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]);
deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]);
}
} catch(Exception e) { }
}
removeAllItems();
teleportToX = 3097;
teleportToY = 3498;
//pEmote = 15;
//pWalk = 13;
sendMessage(“Oh dear, you have died!”);
hitDiff = 0;
updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

public void Poison() {
//if(Poisoned = false)
{
if(PoisonDelay <= 1)
{
poisondmg = true;
newhptype = true;
hptype = 2;
hitDiff = 1 + misc.random(5);
sendMessage(“You start to die of poison.”);
PoisonDelay = 40;
playerLevel[3] -= hitDiff;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
inCombat();
PoisonClear++;
}
if(playerLevel[3] < 1)
{
playerLevel[3] = 0;
}
if(playerLevel[3] == 0) // && (inclanwar = false)
{
ApplyDead();
teleportToX = 3097;
teleportToY = 3498;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
/else if ((inclanwar == true) && (clan == 1)) {
ApplyDead2();
teleportToX = 3097;
teleportToY = 3498;
}
else if ((inclanwar == true) && (clan == 2)) {
ApplyDead2();
teleportToX = 3097;
teleportToY = 3498;
}/
}
}

public void PoisonPlayer()
{
Poisoned = false;
PoisonClear = 0;
PoisonDelay = 40;
Poison = 1;
Poison();
}

public void KBDLair() {
if(absY >= 9517 && absY <= 9546 && absX >= 2630 && absX <= 2650)
if(MonsterDelay <= 1)
{
hitDiff = 3 + misc.random(78);
sendMessage(“You get hit!”);
MonsterDelay = 40;
currentHealth -= hitDiff;
updateRequired = true;
hitUpdateRequired = true;
inCombat();
}
if(currentHealth < 1)
{
currentHealth = 0;
}
if(currentHealth == 0)
{
for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) {
try {
int item = playerEquipment[r];
if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
remove(item, r);
}
} catch(Exception e) { sendMessage(“ERROR: Removing Equipment”); }
}
for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) {
try {
if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {
deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), 1);
}
} catch(Exception e) { }
}
removeAllItems();
teleportToX = 3097;
teleportToY = 3498;
//pEmote = 15;
//pWalk = 13;
sendMessage(“Oh dear, you have died!”);
setSkillLevel(3, 99, playerLevel[3]);
currentHealth = 99;
hitDiff = 0;
updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
}[/code]

It should bring me to coords 3097,3498.

Instead, it brings me to coords 2899, 3557.

So… Can anyone help? It compiles fine and everything, just… Never works.

Read full topic

item.title: Death respawn Point
item.dc:creator: @bbl111 bbl111
item.description:
@bbl111 wrote:

The coords should be in client.java.
Search for

if (deathStage == 2 && System.currentTimeMillis() - deathTimer >= 2500 && !isInPitGame() && !isInFunpk() && !IsInFightCave()) {

until you see this code

if (deathStage == 2 && System.currentTimeMillis() - deathTimer >= 2500 && !isInPitGame() && !isInFunpk() && !IsInFightCave()) { toX = 2906; toY = 3537; AtkPray = 0; StrPrayer = 0; DefPray = 0; RangePray = 0; MagePray = 0; PrayHeal = false; ProtItem = false; ProtMage = false; ProtRange = false; ProtMelee = false; Redemption = false; Retribution = false; Smite = false; Chivalry = false; Piety = false; isSkulled = false; lastSkull = 0; headIcon = 0; turnpray(); heightLevel = 0; currentHealth = playerLevel[playerHitpoints]; deathStage = 0; resetAnimation(); frame1(); prayOn = false; sM("OH EM GEE! YOU DIED!"); sM("You appear to be at the bar near home"); resetOtherAtk(); if (destruct) { absX = 2906; absY = 3537; } savegame(false); }The coords at the top are where you appear after death.

Read full topic
